definition:
Suppose $G \subset {\mathbb{C}}^n$, then we define
$$\log \lVert G \rVert :=
 \{ (\log \lvert z_1 \rvert ,\ldots,
 \log \lvert z_n \rvert) \in {\mathbb{R}}^n
\mid
 (z_1,\ldots,z_n) \in G \} .$$

We say $G \subset {\mathbb{C}}^n$ is a [*logarithmically convex set*]{}
if $\log \lVert G \rVert \subset {\mathbb{R}}^n$ is a convex set.

[9]{} Steven G. Krantz. [**]{}, AMS Chelsea Publishing, Providence,
Rhode Island, 1992.
